name: 張中訓
objective: The course gives an in-depth historical review of Taiwan’s modernizing strategy and process in the second half of the twentieth century, emphasizing the economic, social and political changes in Taiwan over the recent decades. It also focuses on the transformation of the agrarian Taiwanese society into a modern and industrialized one. Within the conceptual framework of development, change, transformation and modernization , major topics will include, but not be limited to land reform, rural construction, local self-government , official economic development plans, the era of white terror and martial law, opposition movement, democracy—Taiwanese style, identity crisis, as well as Taiwan independence vs. reunification with China. The course is intended for students who have no prior knowledge of Taiwanese history.
